item.description:
Schedule for the evening:

7:15 pm: Delicious Potluck Dinner begins.

7:45 - 8:30 pm: Talk and Discussion about “Feeding the Body’s Fuel: Optimum Nutrition for Energy”

8:30 pm - 9:30 on:  Hanging out and clean up

***************************************

Talk and discussion:

We will identify some of the main sources in our daily lives that zap our energy and offer up five simple and powerful ways to feed the body’s fuel. We’ll also talk about some of the best foods to eat to optimize our energy.

***************************************

Our speaker:

Renée Canada is a certified holistic health coach who specializes in chronic pain, stress and weight management, as well as food allergies and autoimmune diseases. She is studying at the Institute of Integrative Nutrition.  A journalist with ten years of experience, Renee has been published in The San Francisco Chronicle, The Hartford Courant, Hartford Women Online, and Moondance: Celebrating Creative Women. Renee is also a trained Girls Circle facilitator and works with girls and young women on issues concerning self-esteem, confidence and body image.

***************************************

About the potluck dinner:

-Many people have dietary restrictions. Be mindful as you prepare your dish, and list the ingredients on a note card at the event.

-This a zero-waste event. Please bring your own plate and utensils.

***************************************

FREE PARKING! In the back of the ArtSpace building. Ignore "Resident Parking Only" signs.Parking is allowed during this event. Enter through the back entrance by the murals.

***************************************

This event is organized by CT Health Foodies, a supportive, dynamic community for people interested in healthy eating.  We organize potluck dinners and talks on the second Tuesday of the month at ArtSpace in downtown Hartford.

We hope you can join us on June 12!
item.name: Potluck Dinner & Talk on Feeding the Body’s Fuel: Optimum Nutrition for Energy
